intro: Saussurea clarkei, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to the extreme conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Saussurea clarkei is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
